message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.CC, cs.CR, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with generating random bits from a biased source, which is a problem in information theory (cs.IT). The algorithm proposed in the paper uses bounded space and runs in expected linear time, which suggests that it may also be relevant to the sub-category of data structures and algorithms (cs.DS). The paper also discusses extending the algorithm to generate random bit streams from correlated sources such as Markov chains, which falls under the sub-category of computational complexity (cs.CC). Since the paper deals with generating random bits, it may also be relevant to the sub-category of cryptography (cs.CR). Finally, the algorithm proposed in the paper has optimal information efficiency as the allotted space increases, which suggests that it may also be relevant to the sub-category of machine learning (cs.LG).
